intro: Sedum potosinum, commonly known as the Potosí stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and small, clustered leaves that are often blue-green in color. The plant produces star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in the spring. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its resilience and ornamental value make it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping.
